description: A helm test suite is a collection of tests with the same purpose and scope defined in one single file.

suite.description: The suite name to show on test result output.
suite.markdownDescription:
**suite** (string) _optional_

The suite name to show on test result output.

snapshotId.description: A suffix to your snapshot file for the tests.  Ideal for helm tests.
snapshotId.markdownDescription:
**snapshotId** (string) _optional_

A suffix to your snapshot file for the tests.  Ideal for helm tests.

tests.description: Where you define your test jobs to run
tests.markdownDescription:
**tests** (array<object>) _required_

Where you define your test jobs to run

it.description: Define the name of the test with TDD style or any message you like.
it.markdownDescription:
**it** (string) _recommended_

Define the name of the test with TDD style or any message you like.

template.description: The template file(s) which render the manifest to be tested, default to the list of template file defined in templates of suite file, unless template is defined in the assertion(s).
template.markdownDescription:
**template** (string) _optional_

The template file(s) which render the manifest to be tested, default to the list of template file defined in templates of suite file, unless template is defined in the assertion(s).

asserts.description: The assertions to validate the rendered chart.
asserts.markdownDescription:
**asserts** (array<object>) _required_

The assertions to validate the rendered chart.

not.description: Set to true to assert contrarily, default to false.
not.markdownDescription:
**not** (boolean) _optional_

Set to `true` to assert contrarily, default to `false`.

template.description: The template file which render the manifest to be asserted, default to the list of template files defined in templates of the suite file, unless the template is in the testjob.
template.markdownDescription:
**template** (string) _optional_

The template file which render the manifest to be asserted, default to the list of template files defined in `templates` of the suite file, unless the template is in the testjob.

containsDocument.description: Asserts the documents rendered by the kind and apiVersion specified.
containsDocument.markdownDescription:
**containsDocument** (object)

Asserts the documents rendered by the `kind` and `apiVersion` specified.

contains.description: Assert the array as the value of specified path contains the content.
contains.markdownDescription:
**contains** (object)

Assert the array as the value of specified path contains the content.

count.description: The count of content to be contained.
count.markdownDescription:
**count** (integer) _optional_

The count of content to be contained.

any.description: Ignores any other values within the found content.
any.markdownDescription:
**any** (boolean) _optional_

Ignores any other values within the found content.

notContains.description: Assert the array as the value of specified path NOT contains the content.
notContains.markdownDescription:
**notContains** (object)

Assert the array as the value of specified path NOT contains the content.

content.description: The content NOT to be contained.
content.markdownDescription:
**content** (object) _required_

The content NOT to be contained.

any.description: Ignores any other values within the found content.
any.markdownDescription:
**any** (boolean) _optional_

Ignores any other values within the found content.

equal.description: Assert the value of the specified path is equal to the value.
equal.markdownDescription:
**equal** (object)

Assert the value of the specified path is equal to the value.

notEqual.description: Assert the value of specified path NOT equal to the value.
notEqual.markdownDescription:
**notEqual** (object)

Assert the value of specified path NOT equal to the value.

value.description: The value expected not to be.
value.markdownDescription:
**value** (object) _required_

The value expected not to be.

equalRaw.description: Assert equal to the raw value.
equalRaw.markdownDescription:
**equal** (object)

Assert equal to the raw value.

value.description: Assert the expected value in a NOTES.txt file.
value.markdownDescription:
**value** (string) _required_

Assert the expected value in a `NOTES.txt` file.

notEqualRaw.description: Assert equal NOT to the value.
notEqualRaw.markdownDescription:
**notEqualRaw** (object)

Assert equal NOT to the value.

value.description: Assert the expected value in a NOTES.txt file not to be.
value.markdownDescription:
**value** (string) _required_

Assert the expected value in a `NOTES.txt` file not to be.

exists.description: Assert if the specified path exists.

notExists.description: Assert if the specified path NOT exists.
notExists.markdownDescription:
**notExists** (object)

Assert if the specified path NOT `exists`.

failedTemplate.description: Assert the value of errorMessage is the same as the human readable template error, or assert that a template failure occurs.
failedTemplate.markdownDescription:
**failedTemplate** (object)

Assert the value of `errorMessage` is the same as the human readable template error.

errorMessage.description: The (human readable) errorMessage that should occur.

errorPattern.description: The regex pattern to match the error (without quoting /).
errorPattern.markdownDescription:
**pattern** (string) _required_

The regex pattern to match the error (without quoting `/`).

oneOf.description: Assert that a failure occurs while templating
oneOf.markdownDescription:
**failedTemplate** (object)

Assert that a failure occurs while templating.

notFailedTemplate.description: Assert that no failure occurs while templating.
notFailedTemplate.markdownDescription:
**notFailedTemplate** (object)

Assert that no failure occurs while templating.

greaterOrEqual.description: Assert the value of specified path is greater or equal to the value.
greaterOrEqual.markdownDescription:
**greaterOrEqual** (object)

Assert the value of specified path is greater or equal to the value.

notGreaterOrEqual.description: Assert the value of specified path is NOT greater or equal to the value.
notGreaterOrEqual.markdownDescription:
**notGreaterOrEqual** (object)

Assert the value of specified path is NOT greater or equal to the value.

hasDocuments.description: Assert the documents count rendered by the template specified. The documentIndex or documentSelector option is by default ignored here.
hasDocuments.markdownDescription:
**hasDocuments** (object)

Assert the documents count rendered by the `template` specified. The `documentIndex` or `documentSelector` option is by default ignored here.

filterAware.description: When true documentIndex or documentSelector is taken into account.
filterAware.markdownDescription:
**filterAware** (boolean) _optional_

When true `documentIndex` or `documentSelector` is taken into account.

lessOrEqual.description: Assert the value of specified path is less or equal to the value.
lessOrEqual.markdownDescription:
**lessOrEqual** (object)

Assert the value of specified path is less or equal to the value.

notLessOrEqual.description: Assert the value of specified path is NOT less or equal to the value.
notLessOrEqual.markdownDescription:
**notLessOrEqual** (object)

Assert the value of specified path is NOT less or equal to the value.

isAPIVersion.description: Assert the apiVersion value of manifest.

isKind.description: Assert the kind value of manifest.

isNullOrEmpty.description: Assert the value of specified path is null or empty (null, "", 0, [], {}).
isNullOrEmpty.markdownDescription:
**isNullOrEmpty** (object)

Assert the value of specified path is null or empty (`null`, `""`, `0`, `[]`, `{}`).

isNotNullOrEmpty.description: Assert the value of specified path is NOT null or empty (null, "", 0, [], {}).
isNotNullOrEmpty.markdownDescription:
**isNotNullOrEmpty** (object)

Assert the value of specified path is NOT null or empty (`null`, `""`, `0`, `[]`, `{}`).

isSubset.description: Assert the object as the value of specified path that contains the content.
isSubset.markdownDescription:
**isSubset** (object)

Assert the object as the value of specified path that contains the content.

isNotSubset.description: Assert the object as the value of specified path that NOT contains the content.
isNotSubset.markdownDescription:
**isNotSubset** (object)

Assert the object as the value of specified path that NOT contains the content.

content.description: The content NOT to be contained.
content.markdownDescription:
**content** (object) _required_

The content NOT to be contained.

isType.description: Assert the value of specified path is the type.
isType.markdownDescription:
**isType** (object)

Assert the value of specified path is the type.

isNotType.description: Assert the value of specified path is NOT the type.
isNotType.markdownDescription:
**isNotType** (object)

Assert the value of specified path is NOT the type.

isNotEmpty.description: Assert the value of specified path is NOT empty.
isNotEmpty.markdownDescription:
**isNotEmpty** (object)

Assert the value of specified path is NOT empty.

isEmpty.description: Assert the value of specified path is empty.
isEmpty.markdownDescription:
**isEmpty** (object)

Assert the value of specified path is empty.

lengthEqual.description: Assert the documents count rendered by the template specified. The documentIndex option is ignored here.
lengthEqual.markdownDescription:
**lengthEqual** (object)

Assert the spec count rendered by the `path|paths` specified.

notLengthEqual.description: Assert the count rendered by the template specified to be equal. The documentIndex option is ignored here.
notLengthEqual.markdownDescription:
**notLengthEqual** (object)

Assert the spec count rendered by the `path|paths` specified NOT to be equal.

matchRegex.description: Assert the value of specified path match pattern.
matchRegex.markdownDescription:
**matchRegex** (object)

Assert the value of specified path match pattern.

pattern.description: The regex pattern to match (without quoting /).
pattern.markdownDescription:
**pattern** (string) _required_

The regex pattern to match (without quoting `/`).

notMatchRegex.description: Assert the value of specified path NOT match pattern.
notMatchRegex.markdownDescription:
**notMatchRegex** (object)

Assert the value of specified path NOT match pattern.

pattern.description: The regex pattern NOT to match (without quoting /).
pattern.markdownDescription:
**pattern** (string) _required_

The regex pattern NOT to match (without quoting `/`).

pattern.description: The regex pattern to match (without quoting /) in a NOTES.txt file.
pattern.markdownDescription:
**pattern** (string) _required_

The regex pattern to match (without quoting `/`) in a `NOTES.txt` file.

notMatchRegexRaw.description: Assert the value NOT match pattern.
notMatchRegexRaw.markdownDescription:
**notMatchRegexRaw** (object)

Assert the value NOT match pattern.

pattern.description: The regex pattern NOT to match (without quoting /) in a NOTES.txt file.
pattern.markdownDescription:
**pattern** (string) _required_

The regex pattern NOT to match (without quoting `/`) in a `NOTES.txt` file.

matchSnapshot.description: Assert the value of path is the same as snapshotted last time.
matchSnapshot.markdownDescription:
**matchSnapshot** (object)

Assert the value of `path` is the same as snapshotted last time.

matchSnapshotRaw.description: Assert the value in the NOTES.txt is the same as snapshotted last time.
matchSnapshotRaw.markdownDescription:
**matchSnapshotRaw**

Assert the value in the NOTES.txt is the same as snapshotted last time.

paths.description: The set of paths to assert.Map keys in path containing periods (.) are supported with the use of a jq-like syntax.
paths.markdownDescription:
**templates** (array<string>) _optional_
. List of specs for length comparison.

path.description: The set path to assert. Map keys in path containing periods (.) are supported with the use of a jq-like syntax.
path.markdownDescription:
**path** (string) _required_

The `set` path to assert.

Map keys in path containing periods (.) are supported with the use of a jq-like syntax.

majorVersion.description: The kubernetes major version, default to the major version which is set by helm.
majorVersion.markdownDescription:
**majorVersion** (integer) _optional_

The kubernetes major version, default to the major version which is set by helm.

minorVersion.description: The kubernetes minor version, default to the minor version which is set by helm.
minorVersion.markdownDescription:
**minorVersion** (integer) _optional_

The kubernetes minor version, default to the minor version which is set by helm.

apiVersions.description: A set of versions, default to the versionset used by the defined kubernetes version.
apiVersions.markdownDescription:
**apiVersions** (array<string>) _optional_

A set of versions, default to the versionset used by the defined kubernetes version.

version.description: The semantic version of the chart, default to the version set in the Chart.
version.markdownDescription:
**version** (string) _optional_

The semantic version of the chart, default to the version set in the Chart.

appVersion.description: The app-version of the chart, default to the app-version set in the Chart.
appVersion.markdownDescription:
**appVersion** (string) _optional_

The app-version of the chart, default to the app-version set in the Chart.

documentIndex.description: The index of rendered documents (divided by ---) to be tested, default to -1, which results in asserting all documents (see Assertion). Generally you can ignored this field if the template file render only one document.
documentIndex.markdownDescription:
**documentIndex** (integer) _optional_

The index of rendered documents (divided by ---) to be tested, default to -1, which results in asserting all documents (see Assertion).

Generally you can ignored this field if the template file render only one document.

documentSelector.description: The path of the key to be match and the match value to assert. Using this information, helm-unittest will automatically discover the documentIndex. Generally you can ignored this field if the template file render only one document.
documentSelector.markdownDescription:
**documentSelector** (object) _optional_

The path of the key to be match and the match value to assert.

Using this information, helm-unittest will automatically discover the documentIndex.

Generally you can ignored this field if the template file render only one document.

matchMany.description: Set to true to allow matching multiple documents.
matchMany.markdownDescription:
**matchMany** (boolean) _optional_

Set to **true* to allow matching multiple documents. Defaults to **false** which means selector has to match single document across all templates.

skipEmptyTemplates.description: Set to true to skip asserting templates which didn't render any matching documents.
skipEmptyTemplates.markdownDescription:
**skipEmptyTemplates** (boolean) _optional_

Set to **true** to skip asserting templates which didn't render any matching documents. Defaults to **false* which means selector have to find at least one document in every template.

skip.description: Using this flag, helm-unittest will automatically skip the 'suite' or 'test'.
skip.markdownDescription:
**skip** (object) _optional_

Using this flag, helm-unittest will automatically skip the 'suite' or 'test'.

reason.description: The reason to skip the `suite` or 'test'.
reason.markdownDescription:
**reason** (string)

The reason to skip the `suite` or 'test'.

minimumVersion.description: The minimum version of helm-unittest plugin required to run this test suite. Do not set **minimumVersion** if you set this.
minimumVersion.markdownDescription:
**minimumVersion** (string) _optional_

The minimum version of helm-unittest plugin required to run this test suite. If set, do not set reason, otherwise the test suite will be skipped regardless of the version.

postRenderer.description: A helm 'post-renderer' to apply after chart rendering but before validation.
postRenderer.markdownDescription:
**postRenderer** (object) _optional_

A helm [post-renderer](https://helm.sh/docs/topics/advanced/#post-rendering) to apply after chart rendering but before validation.

cmd.description: The full path to the command to invoke, or just its name if it's on `$PATH`.
cmd.markdownDescription:
**cmd** (string)

The full path to the command to invoke, or just its name if it's on '$PATH'.

args.description: A list of command-line arguments to pass to the 'cmd'.
args.markdownDescription:
**args** (array<string>)

A list of command-line arguments to pass to the `cmd`.

scheme.description: Define the Kubernetes schema to fake
scheme.markdownDescription:
**scheme**: (object)

Define the Kubernetes schema to fake

objects.description: Define the Kubernetes objects to fake
objects.markdownDescription:
**objects**: (array of objects)

Define the Kubernetes objects to fake

namespace.description: The namespace which release be installed to, default to "NAMESPACE".
namespace.markdownDescription:
**namespace** (string) _optional_

The namespace which release be installed to, default to `"NAMESPACE"`.

revision.description: The revision of current build, default to 0.
revision.markdownDescription:
**revision** (integer) _optional_

The revision of current build, default to `0`.

upgrade.description: Whether the build is an upgrade, default to false.
upgrade.markdownDescription:
**upgrade** (boolean) _optional_

Whether the build is an upgrade, default to `false`.

templates.description: The template files scope to test in this suite. The full chart will be rendered, however only the listed templates are filtered for validation. Template files that are put in a templates sub-folder can be addressed with a linux path separator. Also the templates/ can be omitted. Partial templates (which are prefixed with and _) are added automatically even if it is in a templates sub-folder, you don't need to add them again.
templates.markdownDescription:
**templates** (array<string>) _recommended_

The template files scope to test in this suite. The full chart will be rendered, however only the listed templates are filtered for validation.

 Template files that are put in a templates sub-folder can be addressed with a linux path separator. Also the `templates/` can be omitted.

Partial templates (which are prefixed with and _) are added automatically even if it is in a templates sub-folder, you don't need to add them again.

excludeTemplates.description: The template files which should be excluded from the scope of this test suite. Using wildcards it is possible to exclude multiple templates without listing them one-by-one.
excludeTemplates.markdownDescription:
**excludeTemplates** (array<string>) _optional_

The template files which should be excluded from the scope of this test suite. Using wildcards it is possible to exclude multiple templates without listing them one-by-one.

set.description: Set the values directly in the suite file. The key is the value path with the format just like --set option of helm install, for example image.pullPolicy. The value is anything you want to set to the path specified by the key, which can be even an array or an object.
set.markdownDescription:
**set** (object) _optional_

Set the values directly in the suite file. The key is the value path with the format just like `--set` option of `helm install`, for example `image.pullPolicy`.

The value is anything you want to set to the path specified by the key, which can be even an array or an object.

values.description: The test values to apply for rendering of this chart.
values.markdownDescription:
**values** (array<string>) _recommended_

.The test values to apply for rendering of this chart.
